title: responsibility
comment: An obligation, especially to give account of one's actions. Scripture stresses that the responsibilities which believers and the church have arise from their special and privileged relationship to God.

children.title: responsibility, to God
children.comment: Even though God is sovereign, all people everywhere are accountable to him for everything they do, say or think.

children.title: People are responsible for their own sins
God is not responsible for human sin
Death is the result of sin
The law heightens human responsibility for sin

primaryrefs.comment: Because the law brings knowledge of sin, it prevents people from claiming ignorance of the nature and seriousness of that sin.

children.title: It applies not only to actions but also to words and thoughts
The responsibility of humanity to repent and believe
Jesus Christ's life and ministry heightens the responsibility to repent
responsibility, for God's world
children.comment: All humanity has a moral obligation under God to one another, whether as national leaders, ministers, spouses, parents, children, believers or simply as human beings. This moral obligation is shown in the Scriptures to also include the animal kingdom and the environment.

children.title: To reward good and punish evil
To preach, teach and handle the Scriptures properly
The responsibility of those who are married
The responsibility of parents to their children
The responsibility of children to honour their parents
The responsibility of every believer to represent Jesus Christ in the world
The responsibility of every human being to love God and others
The responsibility to exercise dominion over the animal kingdom and creation
responsibility, examples of
children.comment: Scripture provides examples of individuals and situations in which responsibility is accepted, delegated or denied.

children.title: Joseph over the whole of Egypt
Solomon, not David, to build the temple
Jesus Christ in dying on the cross
The apostles delegated responsibility to seven men
Adam and Eve in eating the fruit
Aaron after making the golden calf
Saul after not destroying everything belonging to the Amalekites
Pilate after ordering Jesus Christ to be crucified
